title: Travis fails on Mac & Python3.6
body:
**Describe the bug**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

After conda-forge channel is added, the default version of `certifi` becomes very old.
As a result, a travis job fails, saying
> Found existing installation: certifi 2016.9.26
ERROR: Cannot uninstall 'certifi'. It is a distutils installed project and thus we cannot accurately determine which files belong to it which would lead to only a partial uninstall.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
On Mac
```
$ conda config --add channels conda-forge
$ conda config --show channels
channels:
  - conda-forge
  - defaults
$ conda create -n test-environment python=3.6
Collecting package metadata (current_repodata.json): done
Solving environment: done

## Package Plan ##

  environment location: /Users/hiromu/miniconda3/envs/test-environment

  added / updated specs:
    - python=3.6


The following packages will be downloaded:

    package                    |            build
    ---------------------------|-----------------
    ca-certificates-2019.9.11  |       hecc5488_0         143 KB  conda-forge
    certifi-2016.9.26          |           py36_0         217 KB  conda-forge
...
```

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

Without conda-forge channel, the version of `certifi` as of 9/12/19 is `2019.6.16`.

**Error Logs/Screenshots**
If applicable, add error logs or screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Mac 10.14.6
- Conda: 4.7.11

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.
